subject: Psychology
title: Confirmation Bias
description: A micro-lesson that makes Confirmation Bias usable.

hook.text: You Google 'is coffee good for you' and only click links that say yes. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: Confirmation bias is the tendency to seek, interpret, and remember information that confirms your beliefs.

discovery.text: Peter Wason's 1960 experiments showed people test hypotheses by looking for support, not refutation.

twist.text: Social media amplifies confirmation bias. Algorithms feed you content that matches what you already believe.

climax.text: Confirmation bias is arguably the most damaging bias â€” it makes every other bias harder to detect.

punchline.text: You don't find the truth. You find what you expected.

quiz.question: What is confirmation bias?
options: Seeking information that confirms existing beliefs
Changing beliefs based on new evidence
